jcr:content.jcr:title: Past Event Highlights
jcr:content.seoTitle: Past Event Highlights | Girl Scouts of San Jacinto

text.text:
For more than 100 years, Girl Scouts has helped girls discover who they are, connect with others and take action to make the world a better place. On April 25, 2014, Girl Scouts of San Jacinto Council (GSSJC) honored longtime Girl Scout volunteers Steve and Joan Gilliland and the accomplishments of Sherry Williams, former senior vice president and compliance officer at Halliburton. The luncheon took place at the Hilton Americas and featured a keynote address by Girl Scout alumna Pegine Echevarria, the first Latina to be inducted into the Motivational Speakers Hall of Fame.

Pegine credits Girl Scouts with saving her life. Through Girl Scouting, she found the courage and confidence to get out of a girl gang in the Bronx. Girl Scouts gave her the confidence to rise above her situation, leave the gang and move to Spain, where she opened two businesses using the skills her Girl Scout leader, a savvy Wall Street business woman, taught her. Pegine excited the crowd of more than 400 Girl Scout supporters and encouraged them to continue their journey of empowering girls to maximize their potential and lead.
